title:
Stochastic Delay Differential Equations have blow-up solutions if and
  only if their instantaneous counterparts have them
abstract:
Motivated by a recent publication by Ishiwata and Nakata (2022), we prove
that sufficiently regular stochastic delay differential equations (SDDEs) with
a single discrete delay have blow up solutions if and only if their undelayed
counterparts have them, using a comparison theorem by Ikeda and Watanabe
(1977). This result has applications in mathematical biology and finance.
